page.title: 19CUSTOMS IN DACRE.
page.content: Easter-After morning service the vicar distributes money to the elderly of the parish and says prayers at The Troutbeck Tombs situated in the churchyard,the custom dates back to the last century. Pasch Eggs-eggs are boiled and decorated,sometimes boiled with onion skins and spring flowers-the decorated eggs are rolled down a hill until they crack. Weddings-Children tie the church gates during the marriage ceremony.They hold a rope across the road until the occupants of the wedding cars throw money which the children scramble for. Luck Money-When the sale of an animal has been transacted,the purchaser always returns a small amount of cash to the vendor as "Luck Money" Guy Fawkes,Hallowe'en are celebrated with bonfires,fireworks,turnip lantern
